statement: Eurozone Dec final mfg PMI 48.8 (vs 49.2 prelim), deeper contraction; Germany final 47.0.
market_link: Weaker EU growth impulse can lean risk sentiment and support quality duration; EUR-sensitive risk can react via 6E/DX.

statement: ECB: Eurozone M3 y/y 3.0% in Nov (Oct 2.8%); M1 y/y 5.0% (Oct 5.2%).
market_link: Incremental euro-area liquidity improvement can affect EUR rates/risk correlations; usually a second-order driver vs PMIs.

statement: US S&P Global final mfg PMI confirmed 51.8 for Dec; expansion but slower than Nov (52.2).
market_link: Steady/softening growth signals mainly transmit to front-end rates and equity cyclicality; limited surprise vs consensus.

statement: Fed NY SRF usage hit record $74.6B on Dec 31 amid year-end funding needs; RRP usage also rose.
market_link: Funding-market tightness can spill into bill/GC repo and front-end rates (ZT) and broader risk tone (ES/NQ).

statement: UK Dec final mfg PMI 50.6 (flash 51.2), still >50 for 2nd month; less momentum than initial read.
market_link: UK data can influence European risk tone and EUR/GBP complex; typically modest direct impact on US index futures.

statement: US cash close: large MOC buy imbalance reported (S&P/NQ/Dow/Mag7 all positive).
market_link: End-of-day index-fund flows can create late-session futures dislocations and next-session gap risk in ES/NQ.
